intro: Cremastosperma magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalena burrseed, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish or reddish and appear in late summer. Cremastosperma magdalenae is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
